dt: {bc}being pleasant and at ease in talking to others

pt: {sc}gracious{/sc} {sc}cordial{/sc} {sc}affable{/sc} {sc}genial{/sc} {sc}sociable{/sc} mean markedly pleasant and easy in social intercourse. {sc}gracious{/sc} implies courtesy and kindly consideration.

pt.t: the {it}gracious{/it} award winner thanked her colleagues
our host was {it}cordial{/it} as he greeted us

pt: {sc}affable{/sc} implies easy approachability and readiness to respond pleasantly to conversation or requests or proposals.

pt.t: though wealthy, she was {it}affable{/it} to all
a {it}genial{/it} companion with a ready quip

pt: {sc}sociable{/sc} suggests a genuine liking for the companionship of others.

quotes.t: In repose, he can be {qword}affable{/qword} and quite funny. But woe betide anyone who crosses him or who fails to perform to his demanding standards.

The owner emerged from a galley kitchen … to explain that the restaurant was supposed to be closed. This roly-poly man with graying locks above a noble, high forehead was {qword}affable{/qword} and articulate, not your average short-order cook.
Bertie's a bright, {qword}affable{/qword} fellow, but every little success he has feels cheapened in comparison with his dad's overpowering accomplishments.
